ollama_generated:
AFFIRMATION:

In consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the parties hereto acknowledge as follows:

Instead of assuming exclusive responsibility for any and all damages resulting from a breach or non-performance under this Agreement by either party (Clause 9.1), each party shall bear its own costs related to such breach or non-performance, unless otherwise provided herein. The non-breaching party may recover only the direct damages caused by the breach, and any consequential or indirect damages are expressly waived (Clause 9.2).

In contrast, this Agreement places a conditional obligation on the parties to mitigate their losses resulting from a breach or non-performance (Clause 9.3), rather than an absolute duty as previously stated. In the event of a breach or non-performance by either party, each party shall employ reasonable efforts to reduce any losses arising therefrom, to the extent practicable under the circumstances. The failure of a party to mitigate its losses does not constitute a waiver of the right to recover damages for such breach or non-performance (Clause 9.4).

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises herein contained, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, WITH THE MUTUAL UNDERSTANDINGS CONTAINED HEREIN SERVING AS COMPENSATION, THE PARTIES INVOLVED AGREE AS FOLLOWS:

This revised clause maintains the original intent of establishing an agreement based on mutual promises. However, it subtly shifts the perception by stating that the understanding and not the actual payment or consideration is what serves as compensation for the parties involved. This change could potentially imply that the obligations or responsibilities between the parties are more informal or goodwill-based, depending on the context of the rest of the contract.

original: 7. AIG hereby waives any failure or delay on the part of the Company in asserting or enforcing any of its rights or in making any claims or demands hereunder.
ollama_generated: 7. The Company acknowledges and agrees that it bears the risk of any failure or delay in asserting or enforcing its rights, or in making any claims or demands under this agreement. AIG shall not be liable for any such lapse on the part of the Company.

original: 9. Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the termination of this Agreement shall have the right to demand that the Company enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement, and, if the Company fails or refuses to take timely action to enforce such rights or the Company defaults in any claim or other payment owed to any such policyholder when due, such policyholder may proceed directly against AIG to enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that no policyholder of the Company may take any action authorized under this paragraph 9 unless and until (a) such policyholder has given AIG written notice of its intent to enforce the terms of this Agreement as provided in this paragraph 9, which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature of and basis for the policyholder's complaint and (b) AIG has failed to comply with this Agreement within sixty (60) days after such notice is given; and, PROVIDED, FURTHER, that upon termination of this Agreement in accordance with paragraph 8 hereof, the rights of any policyholder as provided for under this paragraph 9 shall terminate effective as of the Termination Date, except with respect to the obligation of AIG (if any) to make capital contributions to the Company pursuant to paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement solely to the extent such obligation arose prior to, and remained unsatisfied as of, the Termination Date (it being understood that upon AIG's satisfaction of all such obligations after the Termination Date, no such policyholder shall have any rights against the Company or AIG, as the case may be, under this paragraph 9).
ollama_generated:
9. Upon termination of this Agreement, the Company will relinquish its rights to enforce the provisions outlined in paragraphs 1, 4, and 5, with the exception that any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the Agreement's termination shall retain the right to pursue action against AIG for enforcing these same provisions. This action may be initiated if AIG does not promptly address or refuses to act upon the Company's rights as outlined in paragraphs 1, 4, and 5 within a reasonable timeframe, or fails to fulfill any claim or payment owed to such policyholder when due. However, a policyholder of the Company may only exercise this right following these conditions: (a) The policyholder must provide AIG with written notice detailing their intention to enforce the terms of this Agreement, along with a clear explanation of the basis for their complaint; (b) If AIG does not remedy the breach within sixty (60) days after receiving such notice, the policyholder may then proceed to enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4, and 5.

Upon termination of this Agreement in accordance with paragraph 8, the rights of any policyholder as specified under this clause shall cease to apply, effective as of the Termination Date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, AIG's obligation (if any) to make capital contributions to the Company pursuant to paragraphs 1, 4, and 5 will persist up until the Termination Date, only for those obligations that arose prior to and remained unfulfilled as of that date. It is understood that upon AIG's fulfillment of all such obligations after the Termination Date, no policyholder shall have any rights against the Company or AIG under this clause.

original: 13.The covenants, representations, warranties and agreements herein set forth shall be mutually binding upon and inure to the mutual benefit of AIG and its successors and the Company and its successors.
ollama_generated: 13. The mutual covenants, representations, warranties, and agreements contained herein shall primarily bind the successors of AIG and the Company, while affording them primary benefit, with AIG and the Company retaining secondary obligations and potential advantages.
